The difference between a two-digit number and the number obtained by reversing its digits is $5$ times the sum of the digits of either number.  What is the sum of the two digit number and its reverse?\\
\\
$\textbf{(A) }44\qquad
\textbf{(B) }55\qquad
\textbf{(C) }77\qquad
\textbf{(D) }99\qquad
\textbf{(E) }110$
